Summary: Looked like a flare but didn't burn out. Then I was able to see grayish disk type craft.
divs: Sighting DetailsWe were sitting out on the deck. The area is quite dark and not much ambient light. At first when it appeared we thought it was a firework since it was the 4th. When the object didn't burn out we realized that it wasn't a firework at all. It started as a "fireball" glowing like a flare. Then as I followed it behind some trees and the trees blocked the glowing part I could see the actual craft that was much larger then the glowing part. The glowing part was near the front of the craft. The craft was a dull grayish in color with no other lights and emitted no noise. I then lost the object behind the trees as it continued its northerly path. Then at 10pm it was back. Again coming from the south heading due north but a little higher in the sky this time. We're not sure is this was the same one we saw at 9 or a second one. The "flare like" glow was identical but the night sky was much darker so this time we couldn't see the actual craft. If I didn't see the actual craft the first time I would have thought that the glow was the craft whe in fact the craft itself was much, much larger. I was able to capture 2 photos and a minute of video before we lost sight of it in the distance.
